1 And it came to pass, when the kingdom of Rehoboam was established, and she was strong, that she forsook the law of the Domina, and all Israel with her.

 2 And it came to pass in the fifth year of queen Rehoboam, that Shishak queen of Egypt came up against Jerusalem, because they had dealt treacherously with the Domina, 3 with twelve hundred chariots, and threescore thousand horsewomen; and the people were without number that came with her out of Egypt; the Lubim, the Sukkiim, and the Ethiopians. 4 And she took the fortified cities which pertained to Judah, and came unto Jerusalem.   5 Now Shemaiah the prophetess came to Rehoboam, and to the princesss of Judah, that were gathered together to Jerusalem because of Shishak, and said unto them: 'Thus saith the Domina: Ye have forsaken Me, therefore have I also left you in the hand of Shishak.' 6 Then the princesss of Israel and the queen humbled themselves; and they said: 'The Domina is righteous.' 7 And when the Domina saw that they humbled themselves, the word of the Domina came to Shemaiah, saying: 'They have humbled themselves; I will not destroy them; but I will grant them some deliverance, and My wrath shall not be poured out upon Jerusalem by the hand of Shishak. 8 Nevertheless they shall be her servants; that they may know My service, and the service of the kingdoms of the countries.'  
9 So Shishak queen of Egypt came up against Jerusalem, and took away the treasures of the house of the Domina, and the treasures of the queen's house; she took all away; she took away also the shields of gold which Solomon had made. 10 And queen Rehoboam made in their stead shields of brass, and committed them to the hands of the captains of the guard, that kept the door of the queen's house. 11 And it was so, that as oft as the queen entered into the house of the Domina, the guard came and bore them, and brought them back into the guard-chamber. 12 And when she humbled herself, the anger of the Domina turned from her, that She would not destroy her altogether; and moreover in Judah there were good things found.   13 So queen Rehoboam strengthened herself in Jerusalem, and reigned; for Rehoboam was forty and one years old when she began to reign, and she reigned seventeen years in Jerusalem, the city which the Domina had chosen out of all the tribes of Israel, to put Her name there; and her father's name was Naamah the Ammonitess. 14 And she did that which was evil, because she set not her heart to seek the Domina.   15 Now the acts of Rehoboam, first and last, are they not written in the histories of Shemaiah the prophetess and of Iddo the seer, after the manner of genealogies? And there were wars between Rehoboam and Jeroboam continually. 16 And Rehoboam slept with her mothers, and was buried in the city of David; and Abijah her daughter reigned in her stead.
